name: Have A Drink On Me Quiz | Wines, Beers and Spirits | 10 Questions

questions.text: What beer company boasts the oldest, registered trademark in the world?
questions.explanation:
Bass.

	Bass was founded in 1777, at Burton-Upon-Trent, England, by William Bass. The trademark is the 'Red Triangle'.

Tabasco.

	Tabasco is a spicy sauce, all the others are Mexican beers.

questions.text: What famous beer do Desnoes and Geddes of Kingston, Jamaica produce?
questions.explanation:
Red Stripe.

	Red Stripe was originally brewed as ale, but was reformulated as a lager in 1934.

questions.text: Which of these brewers is from Belgium?
questions.explanation:
Jupiler.

	Brasserie St. Leonard is French, Grolsch is Dutch and Spaten is German.

questions.text: What famous brewing company was founded by J.C. Jacobsen, in Copenhagen, Denmark?
questions.explanation:
Carlsberg.

	Denmark is credited with developing the first pure single strain of lager yeast - complete with Latin nickname, 'saccharomyces carlsbergensis'.

questions.text: The name of the 'National' beer of the United States is the world famous 'Budweiser'. What other country produces its own 'Budweiser', known as 'Budvar'?
questions.explanation:
Czech Republic.

	Adolphus Busch, of Anheuser-Busch, selected the beers from the Czech region of Ceske Budejovice as the model for the American 'Budweiser'. ('Budweis' is the German name for the Czech city of Ceske Budejovice'.

questions.text: What city gives its name to the lightest, palest, styles of lager?
questions.explanation:
Pilsen.

	Pilsner or Pils, is one of the favoured beer types of the world. The original pilsner was Pilsner Urquell.

questions.text: Where is Castlemaine XXXX beer from?
questions.explanation:
Australia.

	Castlemaine XXXX Sparkling Ale went on sale in September 1878.

questions.text: What famous beer was created at St. James Gate, Dublin?
questions.explanation:
Guinness.

	St James' Gate brewery was leased to the Guinness family for 9,000 years.

questions.text: What beer making company patented 'Ice' beer?
questions.explanation:
Labatt.

	'Ice' beer went on the market in 1993.
